level.heading: Full faith and credit to parentage determinations by other states.
level.text: The District of Columbia government shall give full faith and credit to the determinations of parentage made by other states, whether established through voluntary acknowledgment or through an administrative or judicial process.

level.heading: Temporary Addition of Sections
level.text: For temporary (225 day) addition of section, see § 102(b) of the Paternity Acknowledgment and Gas Station Advisory Board Re-establishment Temporary Act of 1996 (D.C. Law 11-206, April 9, 1997, law notification 44 DCR 2401).

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 10-223, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 16-909.

level.heading: Miscellaneous Notes
level.text: Mayor authorized to issue rules: Section 3 of D.C. Law 10-223 provided that, pursuant to Subtitle I of Chaper 15 of Title 1, the Mayor may issue rules to implement the provisions of the act.
Section 28(b)(1) of D.C. Law 15-354 provides that the section designation of § 16-901.2 of the District of Columbia Official Code is redesignated as § 16-901.02.
